column4: hello room, if i restore a database over another one through ssh, does it just append it, or overwrite it completely?
uh, that's a very unclear question, it depends on which type of database, and how you restore it
please keep it on the channel, tks
ok, on a ubuntu server, im restoring a sql backup i made of a database called db1 on top of db1 using this command : mysql -u -p databasename < backup.sql
if you want a clean restore, recreate the database on the restore system before imporing the data.
unless your .sql already contains drop tables...
you drop it and you create it
so executing drop commands on all the tables is "recreating it"?
I was refering to the database, but yes, you could also truncate the tables, if they are not that much
but, depending on how you generate the .sql backup, it may already contain the drop tables
sorry for the noobness, but droping is basically deleting correct?
dropping, is destroying, a database or a table
and truncating is clearing it right?
you really need some DB basic skills :)
thanks, im really working backwards unfortunatly, i know the commands, just not the vocab
